page.title: 01INTRODUCTION-Urban Fringe
page.content: Our block is made up of some very contrasting landuses, the most important being{rural farmland,}with 8 out of the 12 squares being dominated by pastural or arable farming. In the east the most dominant feature is the A19 Trunk Road and the outer edge of Sunderland. The A19 forms a man-made boundary to the urban spread of Wearside and also provides a much needed by-pass for traffic moving between Teesside and Tyneside. In the south west corner there lies the small industrial villages of Shiney Row, New and West Herrington, Philadelphia and Penshaw.Penshaw is the only village that reflects a pre-industrial revolution origin. These villages are separated from Sunderland by a{green belt}and so this block can be descibed as{"Urban {Fringe Land".
